faq.title: Cyclades Travel FAQ
faq.subtitle: Your questions about Greek island travel, answered
faq.a1: The Cyclades are a group of 24 inhabited Greek islands in the Aegean Sea. Famous islands include Santorini, Mykonos, Naxos, and Paros. Known for whitewashed villages, crystal-clear waters, and ancient history.
faq.q2: How do I get to the Cyclades?
faq.a2: Fly to Athens then take a ferry (2-5 hours) or fly directly to Santorini or Mykonos airports. Ferries run daily from Piraeus port to all major islands.
faq.q3: What's the best time to visit Cyclades?
faq.a3: September-October for perfect weather and fewer crowds. May-June is also excellent. July-August is peak season with higher prices and more tourists.
faq.q4: How many days do I need in the Cyclades?
faq.a4: 7-10 days is ideal for visiting 3-4 islands. 2 weeks allows for deeper exploration of 5-6 islands. Even 5 days can work for 2-3 islands.
